authors: Cogan, SF and Edell, DJ and Guzelian, AA and Ping Liu, Y and Edell, R
Device_Substrate: a-SiC Coated Iridium Wire Inside Quartz/Glass Tube
OtherInfo: Mean capsule thickness was 10–12 um. While the measured thickness above a-SiC-coated surface was slightly less than that for quartz or silicone control surfaces, the differences were not statistically significant. Absence of chronic inflammatory response (edema, monocytes, lymphocytes, macrophages, and active fibroblasts) for any of insertion. However, within 100um of the shafts the normal neuron density is observed. Sometimes, a “piling up” of neurons was observed adjacent to the shafts as shown in Figure 17(A). This is caused by lateral displacement and compression of the tissue by the volume of the shaft. Despite this, neurons appeared healthy although somewhat smaller than neurons more distant from the track.  Electrodes = 50um diameter wire, ground at an angle to an oval shape
